Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their, anyone, everything).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use frequently occurring adjectives.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use determiners (e.g., articles, demonstratives).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use end punctuation for sentences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., I named my hamster Nibblet because she nibbles too much because she likes that).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words .

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs (two letters that represent one sound).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Decode regularly spelled one-syllable words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read words with inflectional endings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 1 Language standards 1 and 3 on page 26 for specific expectations.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of closure.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of “how-to” books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.
